title: Jeremy Clarkson shows off two stone weight loss
text:
Jeremy Clarkson in 2018 and now after losing two stone (Picture: Getty)

Jeremy Clarkson has gone and shown off his weight loss after dropping two stone.

The Grand Tour host recently revealed he made changes to his diet after looking at the Queen for inspiration.

And he wasn’t shy to show off his hard work when making an appearance at Fatima Bhutto’s book launch, in London, on Wednesday.

With his girlfriend Lisa Hogan in tow, the 59-year-old looked suave when posing up a storm in front of the camera.

The star could be seen dressed in a navy blazer, that he’d matched with a blue chequered shirt and brown suede boots, while his other half went for the iconic nice top and jeans look.

When chatting to The Sun in August this year, Jeremy spoke about his new diet and where he got his inspo from.

He took inspiration from the Queen’s diet (Picture: Getty Images)

The star looks great (Picture: Getty Images)

‘The Queen doesn’t go to the gym and she doesn’t run and she’s 93 and she’s all right,’ he told the publication.

‘Apparently, she only has a forkful, she only has a tiny bit, that’s what I’ve heard.’

The former Top Gear presenter added: ‘She’ll sit down and just have one little bit of mousse and bit of a lettuce leaf.’

As he cuts back on the steak, and enjoys tiny mouthfuls of lettuce, the star is currently living the life of a farmer for the new Amazon Prime series, I Bought The Farm.

The eight-part-show will see the the controversial star attempt to run his own 1000-acre farm, based in the middle of the British countryside.

He’s currently filming the new Amazon Prime series I Bought The Farm (Picture: PA Images)

A far cry from The Grand Tour, for sure.

Announcing the new project in a video shared by the network, the car enthusiast looked apprehensive as he told his followers what to expect.

He said: ‘Good news, I can finally confirm that I will be spending the next year in the rain making a show about farming for Amazon Prime.

‘That means people all over the world can watch me use 1000-acres of the Cotswolds to make thousands of tonnes of beer, and bread, and lamb chops, and jumpers.’

Jeremy continued: ‘Of course to be a farmer you have to be an agronomist, a businessman, a politician, an accountant, a vet and a mechanic, and I am none of those things. I don’t even know what agronomist means.’

I Bought The Farm [working title] is an Amazon Original series, produced in the UK. A released date is yet to be revealed.
